item.title: Driver and Service
item.description: Code has or supports one of two roles: It adds value to your business It’s the code that drives the prior bullet point The first bullet point is usually called service code. It’s the service your company is being paid to do. The second bullet point can be one of many things, it could be controllers/webapps/etc. It can be chron jobs that perform various functions. It’s the code for how people interact with the system.

item.title: The Mighty Whitespace
item.description: I’ve seen multiple criticisms of Uncle Bob’s Clean Code involving the (short) length of functions. I’ve also seen multiple great responses to those rules of thumb. I want to derive another way to reason about the length of a function. Let’s begin. Thoughts I want the number and density/complexity of thoughts to be the primary measure people think about a function. Now, there’s still cyclomatic complexity, which is a valid metric.
